file_content.text: Always a pleasure to see you.
I'll organize a team to secure that island. We don't want the Empire moving back in.
Back already? That was quick.
Teeseven downloaded some of Angral's communication logs, but the rest were destroyed.
We couldn't get everything.
Some intel is better than none.
Darth Angral's base is destroyed, but my mission was only half successful.
The island is secure.
Right now, we'll take any success we can get.
I'm talented.
Guess it helped being a Jedi instead of a probe droid.
At least the Empire has one less hidey-hole. I'll put together a team, see if we can secure that island for our side.
You should report to General Var Suthra. Be seeing you.
I'd go with you to that island, but I'm allergic to blasters.
Agent Ottau, Republic SIS. Welcome to Ord Mantell.
Hope you enjoy war zones, Master Jedi. This planet's full of them.
What have you learned about Darth Angral's operation here?
Give your briefing, agent.
Why is that?
Long story short, there's a civil war between Republic loyalists and a separatist movement bent on Ord Mantell's independence.
That's the official story. The unofficial one is that the separatists are funded and supplied by the Empire.
My only concern right now is Darth Angral. What have you learned?
One crisis at a time.
That won't end well.
Only reason we're not fighting the Empire now is because they won't commit their own forces. They'd rather throw separatists at us.
If the Empire and separatists want a dirty fight, I'll give them one.
Let's hit them both.
When you're done with Darth Angral, feel free to clean up Ord Mantell. I won't complain.
Open war will be a refreshing change of pace.
Sounds like fun.
Personally, I prefer life in the shadows. It lasts longer.
General Var Suthra had me send a probe droid to the hyperspace data transceiver's location. I learned two things. First, it's on an island.
Second, they don't like visitors there. My probe droid wound up disintegrated. Make sure that doesn't happen to you, eh?
Disintegration isn't on my to-do list.
Thanks for the advice.
You aren't giving me much to go on, agent.
You learned nothing more?
Sorry, but that was my last probe droid.
It won't.
Must be nice. Is your little droid blaster-proof, too?
T7 = small + hard to hit + tricky
When you find the hyperspace data transceiver, plug in your T7 unit and download everything you can from its logs.
With any luck, we'll learn what Darth Angral's been up to. Be seeing you.
You have a nice day. Try not to get shot.
